text: Rich was a champion in Weehawken, and we will all keenly feel his absence. My heartfelt condolences go out to Diane, their son Richard, and all of Rich's family & friends including Mayor Turner, members of the town administration, and the residents that he dedicated his life to.

Rich dedicated over 30 years of his life to ensuring the children of Weehawken had the best education possible. He loved his home town and worked tirelessly to attract new residents to Weehawken to raise their families - just as he did with his wife, Diane.

Our community has already suffered so many losses, personal and public, in our fight against COVID-19. Over the weekend, my good friend, Weehawken President Board of Education and town Finance Director, Richard ‚ÄúRich‚Äù Barsa passed away due to complications of COVID-19.

I am deeply saddened by the news of the passing of Jersey City Councilman Michael Yun from complications of COVID-19. We met several times over his tenure and he always advocated passionately for his Ward D constituents and his beloved Jersey City.

@theryanmoser @MaxineWaters Hi Ryan, after reviewing @RepMaxineWaters plan I think it is exactly the kind of long-term comprehensive action we need to protect workers & families while helping the economy and ensuring states and municipalities have the flexibility and funding they need to handle this crisis

For the duration of the pandemic it proposes suspending negative consumer credit reporting, prohibiting debt collection, repossession, and garnishment of wages, banning all evictions, foreclosures, and repossessions, and providing $5 billion in emergency homeless assistance.
https://t.co/jpTF8FfrfR

It would suspend all consumer and small business credit payments on things like mortgages, student loans, small business loans, etc. throughout the crisis so that people won't fall deeper in debt while they are home or out of work because of the outbreak.

This plan proposes that "the Federal Reserve would be directed through a money-financed fiscal program, to fund automatic stabilizers in the form of at least $2,000 for every adult and an additional $1000 for every child for each month of the crisis."

This is what a comprehensive stimulus package in response to the coronavirus outbreak should look like. Thank you @RepMaxineWaters for compiling an extensive plan that puts workers and families first. https://t.co/idCUHXa0SU

Legislating is often a long and frustrating process but my Democratic colleagues and I will continue working on behalf of the American people. It is no accident that this year's NDAA is progressive, and I'll keep working in Congress to advance our priorities through legislation.

The resolution is called H.Con.Res.83, and it directs the President to terminate the use of America‚Äôs Armed Forces engaged in hostilities in or against Iran. Just as I supported the NDAA provision, I voted for this important resolution.

For example, although the House-passed NDAA included a provision I voted for prohibiting unauthorized war with Iran, the final version of the bill did not. But yesterday, the House voted on a similar War Powers resolution regarding the issue.

Legislating is a process of negotiation and compromise, so not every position we want will be included in a final bill. But our system is designed to allow legislative efforts to evolve ‚Äì just because a policy isn‚Äôt in one bill doesn‚Äôt mean its doomed.

And this NDAA authorizes millions of dollars for military climate readiness and resiliency projects, directs DOD to plan for current climate-change vulnerabilities on our mil bases, and authorizes funding for military clean-energy research projects.

The bill also bans the use of PFAS forever-chemicals in firefighting agents used on military bases and in the packaging used for servicemembers‚Äô field meals, known as MREs. This is an important step forward in limiting the exposure of PFAS chems in our food and water supplies.

And it repeals the ‚ÄúWidow‚Äôs Tax,‚Äù which is what happens when a fallen servicemember‚Äôs surviving spouse ‚Äì who is entitled to two gov. annuity payments ‚Äì has one payment reduced dollar-for-dollar by the other. Surviving spouses depend on these payments. I‚Äôm proud to vote to fix it.

For example ‚Äì and for the first time ever ‚Äì this year‚Äôs NDAA implements 12 weeks of paid parental leave for all federal employees. This leave policy includes leave for birth, adoption, or fostering.
But this year‚Äôs NDAA is among the most progressive ever enacted thanks to House Democrats prioritizing medical, family leave, environmental, and health provisions.

The NDAA is a massive bill (this year‚Äôs was over 1,000 pages long) that includes authorization and funding-level agreements for nearly every program run by the Department of Defense (DOD) ‚Äì this includes servicemember pay, funding for arms upgrades, and so on.

Each year, Congress gets together to debate which national defense programs to reauthorize and which ones to reel in. This is done through a legislative vehicle known as the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).
This bill is an important step towards preventing contamination of our food and water sources by a possibly-harmful chemical. It passed the House by a vote of 247 to 159 and now goes to the Senate.
